answers.answer: The physician will know what tests to take.They often get very annoyed when a patient suggests tests.You have several problems, one of which may be diabetes.The most important thing is for a patient to describe symptoms in their own words.Post back when you get a diagnosis.

Caregiver is correct, let your doctor get to the bottom of your problems their way. For starters, with a physical exam the doctor will inspect you from head to toe. Google search 'physical exam' for a complete checklist of what to expect. Good luck.
sounds to me you have some anxiety going on .
did you get a glucose tolerance test? or just fasting sugar?Have you gotten your thyroid, hormones checked?

question: Hi,Over the past year I have experienced all the classic symptoms of Type II diabetes only to have my bloodwork come back in normal ranges.  On a daily basis I have:1) Night sweats2) Frequent urination3) Constant hunger4) Constipation5) Weight loss: Lost 15lbs in the past 3 months and have not changed how much I eat.6) Both hands and feet will get numb/cold7) Black specks in vision.8) Severe mood swings.  If I eat something like a piece of cake I get this feeling of rage that is quite scary and it will last about 4 hours.9) Pounding heart beat like it is coming out of my chest.10) Migraines. Not sure if this is tension or not but I can feel them coming up the back of my neck.11) Seem to get recurring skin rashes and now have some kind of fungus on one of my toenails.Thurdsay I have a doctors appt and was wondering if anyone could recommend what tests I should request from her.   Thanks in advance for any help.
title: Can't take it anymore!
